dialog.logout_description: Are you sure you want to log out of your account?

stats_message_line1: At Refad, we present numbers as recorded
stats_message_line2: and leave the impact assessment to human conscience.
contactDescription: We welcome all feedback and suggestions that help improve our services...
supportMessage: The technical support and customer service department is dedicated to assisting you around the clock.
transparencyDescription: We first and foremost respect your privacy...
transparencyParagraph: We place great importance on your privacy and strive to protect all information you provide to us while using our website or services. The data you voluntarily provide, such as your name and contact information, is collected solely to improve service quality and communicate with you effectively. We are committed not to share or sell any of your personal data to third parties without your prior consent, except in cases required by law or necessary for humanitarian purposes. We also apply strict security measures to protect your data from unauthorized access or misuse. By using our website, you agree to this privacy policy. We reserve the right to update it from time to time in line with the development of our services. Any changes will be published on this page once approved, so we recommend visiting it periodically to stay informed of the latest updates. testimonials.title: User Testimonials
testimonials.description: We are proud of everyone who shared the journey with us and contributed to achieving humanitarian impact. Here are some words we cherish that encourage us to continue giving.

campDetails.title: Camp Details
campDetails.defaultDescription: Jabalia Camp is the largest shelter for Palestinian refugees in Palestine, with 119,000 Palestinians living in an area of no more than 1.4 square kilometers, making it one of the most densely populated places in the world. Jabalia refugees are descendants of 38,000 Palestinians who were ethnically cleansed from Ashdod, Jaffa, Ramla, Lydda, and Beersheba during the 1948 Nakba. Jabalia Camp is the largest shelter for Palestinian refugees in Palestine, with 119,000 Palestinians living in an area of no more than 1.4 square kilometers, making it one of the most densely populated places in the world.
